definition:
Let $R$ be a commutative ring and $R\langle X \rangle$ be a free algebra
over $R$ on a set $X$ of *non-commuting* variables. A two-sided ideal
$I$ of $R\langle X\rangle$ is called a $T$-*ideal* if
$\phi(I)\subseteq I$ for any $R$-endomorphism $\phi$ of
$R\langle X\rangle$.

For example, let $A$ be a $R$-algebra. Define $\mathcal{T}(A)$ to be the
set of all $f\in R\langle X\rangle$ for $A$. Then $\mathcal{T}(A)$ is a
$T$-ideal of $R\langle X\rangle$. $\mathcal{T}(A)$ is called the
$T$-*ideal of of A*.
